input_text:
Job Title: Buliding Maintenance Tech, healthcare, weekend availability required

Location: Burlington, MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
When you join the growing BILH team, you're not just taking a job, you’re making a difference in people’s lives.

Job Type:

Regular

Scheduled Hours:

40

Work Shift:

Day (United States of America)

Under the supervision of the Assistant Director, Plant Operations, provides a variety of administrative and lead maintenance functions for the Engineering and Maintenance Department and coordinates special projects as assigned.

Job Description:

Essential Duties and Responsibilities including but not limited to:

 Maintains inventory of repair parts for patient transport equipment, Patient TV’s, patient related furniture and other building materials. Reports inventory to Maintenance Lead.  Maintains equipment as needed.  Works in conjunction with department Managers, ensuring the proper selection and installation of preferred building materials and other specialty items.  Completes and documents maintenance work order assignments on a daily basis.  Performs repair/preventive maintenance as needed, or assigned.  Provides general renovation and installation services, repairing partitions, ceilings and floors.  Maintains parts inventory and repairs patient TV’s, patient transport equipment, exam room tables, patient room furnishings, pneumatic tube system equipment, blood pressure equipment, etc.  Provides support to Assistant Director as needed, arranging minor contract repairs and equipment installations.  Performs general building repairs of partitions, doors, windows, floors, etc. in a neat workmanlike manner.  Installs shelves, cabinets and other small carpentry items in a neat, workmanlike manner.  Completes required paperwork in a neat and timely manner, i.e. work orders, requisitions, logs and daily report. 

Minimum Qualifications:

Education: High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED). Vocational/trade school courses preferred.

Licensure, Certification, Registration: None required.

Skills, Knowledge & Abilities:

Working knowledge of building repairs, i.e. carpentry, flooring, Hilti fire stopping techniques, TV cable repair. Familiar with computer use for equipment/data material search. 

Experience: Four years progressive experience in general building maintenance in a healthcare facility.

FLSA Status:

Non-Exempt

As a health care organization, we have a responsibility to do everything in our power to care for and protect our patients, our colleagues and our communities. Beth Israel Lahey Health requires that all staff be vaccinated against influenza (flu) and COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Learn more about this requirement.

More than 35,000 people working together. Nurses, doctors, technicians, therapists, researchers, teachers and more, making a difference in patients' lives. Your skill and compassion can make us even stronger.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Buliding Maintenance Tech
output_json.summary: Join the growing BILH team, making a difference in people’s lives.
job_responsibilities: Ensures proper selection and installation of building materials
Completes and documents maintenance work order assignments
Provides general renovation and installation services
Repairs patient TV’s, patient transport equipment, etc.
Arranges minor contract repairs and equipment installations
